Text.text: How many weeks after the start of the semester does the free drop/add period end?
Correct! The free drop/add period ends two weeks after the semester begins.
Incorrect: this is not when the free drop/add period ends.
Incorrect: this is not when the free drop/add period ends.
Incorrect: this is not when the free drop/add period ends.
After the free drop/add period ends, are you stuck in the class?
No, you can still withdraw without academic penalty before a given date
Correct! You can withdraw from a class without academic penalty before the academic penalty deadline.
Incorrect: you are not stuck in a class after the free drop/add deadline passes.
No, you can drop the class at any time, but you must pay a fee
This statement is incorrect because after the academic penalty deadline, you may NOT drop a class without a valid excuse.
No: you can add a class at any time, but it may be a lot of work
Incorrect: no schedule changes are permitted after the academic penalty deadline without an acceptable excuse.
How many weeks after the start of the semester is the deadline to withdraw from a class?
Incorrect, this is not the deadline to withdraw from a class.
Correct! You may withdraw from a class up to the eighth week of the semester.
Incorrect, this is not the deadline to withdraw from a class.
Incorrect, this is not the deadline to withdraw from a class.
What is the procedure for changing your major?
Schedule a meeting with your advisor
Incorrect: this is not the procedure for changing your major.
Email your advisor asking him/her to change your major
Incorrect: this is not the procedure for changing your major.
Fill out a Change of Major form on UDSIS
Correct! By filling out this form, the relevant departments will be notified and will be able to approve the change.
Ask the dean of the department of the major you are switching into
Incorrect: this is not the procedure for changing your major.
What is NOT an acceptable reason to have your schedule changed after the academic penalty deadline?
Family problems
Incorrect: family problems may be an acceptable reason to have your schedule changed after the academic penalty deadline.
Poor academic performance
Correct: poor academic performance is NOT an acceptable reason to have your schedule changed after the academic penalty deadlne.
Death of a relative
Incorrect: death of a relative may be accepted as a reason to have your schedule changed after the academic penalty deadline.
Emotional difficulties
Incorrect: emotional difficulties may be an acceptable reason to have your schedule changed after the academic penalty deadline.
Which of these websites is NOT used by professors to post important course information?
Incorrect: Sakai is often used by professors to post important course information.
Incorrect: Canvas is often used by professors to post important course information.
A professor's own course webpage
Incorrect: professors sometimes have their own wepage where they post important course information.
Correct! Professors do NOT post course information on UDSIS. However, grades, class meeting time and place, and final exam time for a course CAN be found on UDSIS.
